de.unistuttgart.vis.wearable.os.sensorDriver

Class GenericSensorDriver

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.unistuttgart.vis.wearable.os.sensorDriver.GenericSensorDriver

  • public class GenericSensorDriver
extends java.lang.Object
    A simple generic sensor driver This is still work in progress since a lot of improvements are to be made
    Author:
    roehrdor

    • Constructor Detail

      • GenericSensorDriver

        public GenericSensorDriver(java.lang.String driverName,
                           int dimension,
                           int dataChunkSize,
                           byte[] chunks,
                           int sensorID,
                           SensorDriverCallback sensorDriverCallback)
        Create a new Generic Driver with the given parameters
        Parameters:
        driverName - the driver name
        dimension - the dimension
        dataChunkSize - the size of a data chunk (single data with all dimensions)
        chunks - this contains the offset and the size of each dimension of the data chunks
        sensorID - the sensor the driver shall be used for
        sensorDriverCallback - if this callback handle is set the according function is called every time we get new sensor data

    • Method Detail

      • cleanBuffer

        protected void cleanBuffer()
        Reset the buffer, looking at the byte representation set all bytes to zero

      • input

        public boolean input(byte[] b,
                     int offset)
        Get the input bytes from the byte array starting at the given offset in the given array
        Parameters:
        b - the array to store all the values
        offset - the offset where to start reading in the array
        Returns:
        true if input parameters were valid and data has been set

      • execute

        public void execute()
        Execute the driver and process the read data

      • checkFailure

        public static int checkFailure(java.lang.String driverName,
                               int dimension,
                               int dataChunkSize,
                               byte[] chunks)
        Check if the given input values are valid
        Parameters:
        driverName - the driver name
        dimension - the dimension
        dataChunkSize - the size of a data chunk (single data with all dimensions)
        chunks - this contains the offset and the size of each dimension of the data chunks
        Returns:
        0 if no error is found
